userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The materials from Washington and Lee University Special Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study, pursuant to U.S. Copyright law. The user assumes full responsibility for any use of the materials, including but not limited to, infringement of copyright and publication rights of reproduced materials. Any materials used should be fully credited with the source. Permission for publication of this material, in part or in full, must be secured with the Head of Special Collections.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Preferred citation: [Identification of item], James Noah Hess Scrapbook, WLU Coll. 0413, Special Collections and Archives, James G. Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University, Lexington, VA
In some cases the citation format may vary. Please contact Special Collections' staff to verify the appropriate format.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of a scrapbook, entitled 'My Memory Book, W.I.H.S.' and accompanying material from James Noah Hess, Washington and Lee University class of 1930. W.I.H.S stands for Washington Irving High School in Clarksburg, West Virginia.

controlaccess.subject: Scrapbooks
Printed ephemera
Maps
Travel
controlaccess.corpname: Washington Irving High School (Clarksburg, W. Va.)

did.unittitle: Folder, with various ephemeral and printed items.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Folder, containing 1 map of 'Mexico, Central America and The West Indies' for National Geographic Magazine, 1934; 1 envelope containing photos and ephemera; 2 copies of 'The Hilltop' from Washington Irving High School in Clarksburg, WV from May 21, 1926, Vol. IV No. 15; 1 writing pad from Hess' voyage with various ephemeral items contained there-in.
